Material Studies — These materials were created using real-world measured values, and rendered using PBR techniques.

Isometric — Who doesn’t enjoy isometric rooms?

DELAKTIG-Inspired — Inspired by Ikea’s DELAKTIG bed frame: the unofficial bedstand.

Micro Hydro System — Dimensions on a napkin never looked so good!

Placeholder — Responsive testing? Quick, make a “placeholder” image!

Musk, by Elon — Coming soon: Musk by Errol.

Road Ranger — My partner and I bought and renovated a vintage camper! The Looks As we planned our changes, I modeled them up and rendered them out. Who knew Blender could be such a wonderful project planning

Fields of Gold —

Ninja — Thank you Darrin Lile for your character modeling tutorials. I was still in the Halloween spirit when I made this little fella.

Patch —

NURBS — Thank you to Rusty Hazelden for this tutorial on NURBS Modeling. Although Blender doesn’t have a NURBS implementation, I was able to find comparable functionality throughout the series.

Sky Writing — Playing around with Blender’s volumetrics.

Satellite Tower — The snow load keeps knocking my satellite dish out of alignment. So I modelled up a solution, and turned this render into reality! It seems to do the trick.

Character Work — Playing around with Blender’s Skin modifier to create my first character, and her weird amorphous cat.

Cluster Builder — Mr Cluster was created for ID Studios to guide users through configuration and deployment of containers using Cluster Builder.

2D Elements — Playing around with 2D elements for a collage-style look.

Still Life — Thank you Stephen Woods for this in-depth introduction to Blender!

Office — Playing around with procedural textures ie wood planks, galvanized steel, and finger-printed glass.

Inset and Extrude — Playing around with Blender’s Inset and Extrude functionality.

Donut — Thank you to Blender Guru for the whimsical introduction to Blender! :)
